intro: Delissea nelsonii, commonly known as the Nelson's delissea, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear white or pale yellow flowers, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
